column4: uh. So. Yeah. My laptop has been overheating (100C) a lot ever since I got ubuntu.
Only since I got ubuntu in fact. It's never overheated before.
Yeah
._. It's not overheating right at this moment
Uh. It doesn't just start overheating as soon as it is on. Usually after a few hours of use it will start in the 80s or 90s
Oh, but youtube videos for some reason make it heat up REALLY fast
Yeah, I realize this.
But 100C is insane
Yeah, it's at 62C. right now.
But I've been told that's normal for AMD or whatever.
what kind of laptop is it?
get a fan plate if you are using it mostly at home, and turn off compiz when you arent
clean out your fans as step one
compiz are ubuntus 3d effects desktop
you can right click the panel and add the CPU speed meter
then you see if your CPU drops down to lower mhz when it isnt in use
if it doesnt then your speed step isnt working, that would make some extra heat to
then search for CPU and you find it
if it doesnt, we have found a possible heat source =)
is it a 800mhz laptop?
listen to your fans, are they running?
